revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=Arlo |revision=Bridge (ABB1000) |fcc_date=03/19/2018 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Delta Networks |type=IoT |fcc_id=PY317300394 |ic_id=4054A-17300394 |pcb_id=2976552902 |pwr_v=100-240 |pwr_amp=0.2 |pwr_conn=AC (direct) |pwr_ac_hz=50/60 |cpu1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |cpu1_model=QCA4531;QCA4531-BL3A; |fla1= |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model= |ram1= |ram1_brand=Winbond |ram1_model= |wi1_chip1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=QCA4531;QCA4531-BL3A; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_none=true |addl_chips=Bluetooth 4.2 Chip;Qualcomm (CSR);CSR102x;;1; |flags=Bluetooth 4.2 LE, |802dot11_protocols=bgn |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|Arlo Bridge}}
"2976552902" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
Bluetooth chip is probably a [[Qualcomm]] ([[CSR]]) [https://www.qualcomm.com/products/csr102x-chipset-product-family CSR102x] :since FCC docs say it supports Bluetooth 4.2. "Designed for: Arlo Security Lights"
*[http://www.arlo.com/en-us/landing/arlo-security-light/ ''Arlo Security Light'' on '''Netgear''']
